reviews.text: This is a really good place to stay especially for the area, the hotel is newly renovated. We got the bargain room I guess which was an outside wood staircase in good condition was not very slippery in the rain. There is no elevator in the 2 story hotel. There are a lot of rooms downstairs with indoor access. The beds are incredibly comfortable, rooms average to larger than a motel, and very comfortable. The pool was nice and warm and clean, and the jacuzzi was good about the size of a queen sized bed in width and about 8-10 feet long, about 8 people could fit max, needless to say it was popular but not overcrowded. The location is busy as it is IN the shopping outlet parking lot, a shoppers Mecca if you are into that, we were there for a restful weekend and ended up coming home with lots of purchases. The restaurant on the premises (not adjoined) was great for dinner, don't get room service just call and walk over to pick up or go order the menu is more extensive and you save on the gratuity charge.The staff is very friendly and helpful. The food is Pub fare, very delicious, the first night I ordered hot wings and got 'to die for' wings with an amazing sauce, not too hot, the next night I ordered the same thing and got just buffalo wings. Maybe a different cook? However DO NOT HAVE THE BREAKFAST BUFFET!!!! Overpriced for sub standard food, they were low on everything, and even when replenished it was generic, waffles were melting, omelets bad, sausage links were probably Swift Premium brown and serve. We had an amazing breakfast at the Tamarack Inn just the right amount food, of tasty potatoes awesome homemade bread etc.
reviews.title: Better Than Expected

reviews.text: I stayed with my wife and 2 very young kids and have no a single complaint.
reviews.title: Very comfortable roomy suite

reviews.text: The two bedroom suite is excellent, very roomy and comfortable, A king bed for the couple, a queen for one kid and a crib for the baby. In addition to that, two TVs (one flat screen), fridge, microwave and courtesy Colombian coffee. The bathroom was shinny.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff, Clean Rooms
Nice Place
reviews.text: The location is 5 minutes from Canada Street (Lake George touristic area), but excellent anyway. It is just in the middle of the outlet stores and you have there much more interesting options around there to have a decent meal than on Canada St.
If we return to the Lake George area, we will stay at that hotel surely.
reviews.title: Great bang for the buck!
Clarion Inn and Suites Lake George New York
reviews.text: It your are traveling to the Lake George area, you won't miss a beat if you stay at the Clarion Inn and Suites in Lake George, N.Y. I liked to hotel because staff is helpful and friendly, and everything is near by. The hotel's pool i great too. Flat screen tvs in the room..too..

Stayed in a one bedroom suite and was very happy. While planning a short trip to the Great Escape Lodge waterpark I spent hours looking for lodging that would give our 19 month old a seperate room to sleep. I am familiar with the area and couldn't find a thing. The only thing that might have worked in the waterpark lodge did not look like it had a door on the room and 2 nights would have cost over $700. I have no problem spending that amount of money if I am going to be staying at a four or five star establishment but that was not going to be the case here. Most of the Lake George resorts and vacation rentals are seasonal. I was about to reserve a 3 bedroom cabin in Hauge when I came across the Clarion. Calling the hotel I spoke to a friendly, helpful front desk person who understood my needs. The room was wonderful....spacious and very clean. The seperate bedroom with a king bed had french doors with frosted glass and a flat screen tv. My son set up his crib in there. The main room had a sitting area with couch, coffee table, sink , fridge,microwave and flat screen tv... the sleeping area had a queen bed. Bed was extreamly comfortable. Two dresser and a large closet for plenty of storage space. I was shocked over the niceness of the bathroom. There was an entrance from the main room and the bedroom. Tiled floor, beautiful countertop. A pocket door seperated the sink from the toilet and bath area. Deep jetted tub and seperated shower. Neutrogena toiletries. In a pinch we went to the hotel restaurant, again what a surprise! Usually would not be a choice but this place was actually good!We travel a lot and I stay away from almost all chain hotels because they are so hit and miss, with the odds in favor of miss. I like a nice place and have been called a room snob. This Clarion has me changing my normal patterns when looking for lodging.
reviews.title: Happily surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and My Lady stayed at the Clarion Inn & Suites, Soon as you alk in the Hotel is very Clean and the area is Perfect with Mountain Sceneries. We Stayed in a King Size SUite and it was so Clean, and Spacious. Seperate Living room with falt screen tv and seperate Bedroom very spacious. The bathroom was so clean and very opened with seperate SHower and seperate Jacuzzi tub. We had such a Relaxing time here we will definitely be staying again.
reviews.title: Loved Every Minute of this Place Right in SHopping District.

reviews.text: My daughter and I and her 3 kids stayed in one of Clarion's 2 BR suites. It had a sitting area w/ t.v.; desk; refrig; and microwave. Each Bedroom had it's own t.v. Not only was the suite amazingly spacious, it was beautifully decorated (very fresh); had a very elegant granite bathroom (also very spacious). At children's "nap time", adults had space to watch t.v.; snack ; do work at the desk or read -- without fear of awakening nappers.
reviews.title: Loved Spacious Suite at Clarion

reviews.text: On top of all this, the hotel is ideally situated: very near Lake George Village and in the center of outlet shopping.
reviews.title: Amazing Suites in the heart of outlet shopping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At first look, the room looked renovated, the beds looked clean but, the room smelled a bit. (had the old/aged smell). Guess, the forgot to change the carpet or clean it!
reviews.title: Room looks renovated but, hotel still feels old

reviews.text: The big NO NO was that the TOILET was not cleaned! Called the front desk, instead of assigning a new room or they sent housekeeping to clean it. We were there for one night therefore, didn't want to make it a big deal. The breakfast in the morning was somewhat pathetic especially the coffee!
reviews.title: incredible experience

reviews.text: I've travelled a lot but have never posted a review untill now. I stayed in a suite at the Clarion for 5 weeks and had a few favors to ask and every one was fullfilled with the highest regard for my comfort. Every person that works there from the owners daughter(whom i met and is extremely nice) to the manager(who was very helpful on all levels, to the breakfast girls, were all extremely nice and helpful. There are not to many suites that offer 1 or even 2 seperate bedrooms from the common room, but this has it all. Cleanliness, very nice staff and an all around great place to stay. I would go back anytime. Location is perfect, close to Great escape, shopping, restaurants and the night life without being down town. Thanks Clarion you made my business stay a pleasurable one.
reviews.title: roomy accomodations...helpful staff

reviews.text: Upon arrival to the hotel, walking through the hallway to get to our room, my husband and I noticed how dirty the carpet was, and how "yucky" it smelled. Thank goodness when we arrived to our 2 bedroom suite, it appeared quite clean and odor-free. The only mishap was that I found a worn pair of mens briefs hanging from the shower rod. The bed was moderately comfortable. The air conditioner was at body level so that it blew directly on my husband while sleeping at night...the vent could not be redirected. The courtesy continental breakfast was O.K., though my kids loved being able to stuff themselves with store bought donuts and fruitloops (they also had pastries, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, cold cereal, bagels, assorted breads/spreads, coffee/tea and juices). Again the carpet was soiled, the fabric chairs were stained, and many of the bowls didn't have serving utensils...how were all these people retrieving the food? I do think with some relatively minor changes and attention to detail, the common areas in this hotel could be improved. The rooms themselves are nice. If they had been anything like the common areas, I would not have stayed. I would also like to mention that the staff were polite and helpful.
reviews.title: Clarion Inn & Suites, Lake George...OUTSTANDING!

reviews.text: We have just returned from Lake George, NY and feel we must get the word out.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly staff! very convenient. You can walk to the outlets. Clean room!
reviews.title: Clean and great location

reviews.text: Lake George NY, USA, is wonderful . The people are AWESOME. Stayed at Clarion Inn & Suites (with an indoor pool), the service was truly outstanding. Many thanks to Alexis for all her help, their are many workers in the service industry that can learn a thing or two from you!
reviews.title: Top Notch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me start by stating that this hotel is in a great location. The outlets are literally next door, Six Flags is less than a mile down the road and downtown Lake George is a few miles away. All accessible by the trolley/bus that runs down route 9, where the hotel is conveniently located. The staff is super friendly, helpful, and accomodating. We stayed in a one bedroom suite, which was more than enough room for two people.There was a pullout couch, king size bed (which was extremely comfortable), two flat screen tv's, mini fridge, microwave, granite countertops,and tiled bathroom floors and walls. Overall clean room and hotel. The pool is not that big, but neither is the hotel. My only tip would be if you do not want to be surrounded by families and kids, this may not be the hotel for you. Definitely my top choice of lodging when in the area again.
reviews.title: Spacious, clean, comfortable, newly renovated rooms & super friendly/helpful staff.

reviews.text: We stayed here for a week for the Americade motorcycle rally, and were very pleased with our room. We had the 1 bedroom suite and it was perfect for us. My husband is the early bird, so when he would get up in the mornings, he could still go into the sitting area and watch tv without waking me. The bathroom is great because it seperates the shower/toilet area from the vanity area, and we had a whirlpool too.
reviews.title: Great Place To Stay Near Outlets

reviews.text: Sara Jane at the front desk was very helpful when I called to make our reservations and was just as friendly once we arrived and checked in. I highly recommend talking with her to make your plans, if possible.
reviews.title: Exceptional Property at an Unbelievable Price!
